Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(agent)</font> suggests/proposes idea/action x<sub>2</sub> to audience x<sub>3</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font> inspires x<sub>2</sub> in/among x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(source)</font> is quiet/silent/[still] at observation point x<sub>2</sub> by standard x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a male/buck of species x<sub>2</sub> evidencing masculine physical/biological/genetic trait<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font>; x<sub>1</sub> is masculine.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of protein/albumin of type x<sub>2</sub> composed of amino acids <span class="word-kind">(sequence/jo'u)</font> x<sub>3</sub> .

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a material object enduring in space-time; x<sub>1</sub> is a thing.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects [Loglandic]/Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.

Example_1: mi finti le pemci be le vrici prenu - I create poems about different people.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is x<sub>2</sub> ampere<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> [metric unit] in current <span class="word-kind">(default is 1)</font> by standard x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> adds/combines x<sub>2</sub> to/with x<sub>3</sub>, with result x<sub>4</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> augments x<sub>2</sub> by amount x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(person)</font> is serious/earnest/has gravity about x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state/activity)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a/the finger/digit/toe [body-part] on limb/body site x<sub>2</sub> of body x<sub>3</sub>; [metaphor: peninsula].

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is the trigonometric sine of angle/arcsine x<sub>2</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> pertains to the Christian religion/culture/nationality in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [person/passive/state] undergoes/experiences x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/experience)</font>; x<sub>2</sub> happens to x<sub>1</sub>.

Etymology: kasam(ar), davaid(en), divid(es), bag(hi), dil(ru), fen(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source x<sub>2</sub>.

Example_1: mi pu citka pa snuji be le matne bei le nanba - I ate a sandwich with butter and bread.
Related: grasu (fat), kruji (cream)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is lightning/electrical arc/thunderbolt striking at/extending to x<sub>2</sub> from x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: bark(ar), laitnin(en), relampag(es), bijli(hi), molin(ru), leidian(zh)
Example_1: sa'u tu pe pu ku cu lindi le darno pa dilnu - That was just a lightning that stroke far away from here striking from a cloud.
Related: letri

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a cylinder [shape/form] of material x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: ustuuan(ar), silndr(en), silindr(es), belan(hi), silindr(ru), iuanju(zh)
Example_1: mi zgana le nu le karce pe mi zi'e pe le xa mei slanu cu zmadu le laldo karce pe mi le ka vlipa vau so'i da - I notice that my 6-cylinder car is much more powerful than my old car.
Related: kamju (column), gunro (roll)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(du'u)</font> is news/tidings/new information about subject x<sub>2</sub> from source x<sub>3</sub>, to observer x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: anba(ar), nuz(en), novas(es), xabar(hi), novast(ru), cinuen(zh)
Example_1: ma nuzba - What's up? What are the news?
Example_2: no da nuzba fi mi fo do - No news from me for you.
Related: cnino (new), notci (message)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a [biological] offspring/child/kid/hybrid of parent<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>2</sub>; <span class="word-kind">(adjective:)</font> x<sub>1</sub> is filial.
Etymology: sulala(ar), prajeni(en), proxeni(es), apatia(hi), patomak(ru), zi(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u nixli cu panzi la alis - The girl is Alice's child.
Related: grute (fruit), verba (child), bersa (son), tixnu (daughter), se, rorci (procreate), patfu (father)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a frame/structure/skeleton/outline supporting/load-bearing/determining the form of x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: xaikal(ar), freim(en), estruktur(es), danc(hi), struktur(ru), geu(zh)
Example_1: le greku be le mi'u bitmu cu mudri - The frame of the fence is wooden.
Related: korbi (edge), stura (structure), tsina (stage), bongu (bone)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a/the sweat/perspiration from body x<sub>2</sub>, excreted by gland<span class="word-kind">(s)</font>/organs x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: arik(ar), suet(en), sud(es), pasin(hi), pot(ru), xan(zh)
Example_1: le xasne be ra cu se cigla ti - His sweat is secreted by these glands.
Related: pinca (urine), vikmi (excrete), cigla (gland)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [member] is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font> among members of x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(set)</font>.
Etymology: itiiadi(ar), kamn(en), ordinari(es), samani(hi), abidien(ru), fan(zh)
Example_1: fi le'i pendo be mi cu fadni fa la kevin le ka cusku le simsa noi srana mi - It's common for my friends and Kevin in particular to say such things about me.
Related: cafne (frequent), rirci (rare), kampu (common), lakne (likely), tcaci (custom), cnano (average)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font> destroys/ruins/wrecks/despoils x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is destructive.
Etymology: damar(ar), distroi(en), destru(es), dvast(hi), razruc(ru), po(zh)
Example_1: ra pu daspo le ka kanro - He ruined his health.
Example_2: le fagri pu daspo ci me le dinju - The fire destroyed three of the buildings.
Related: spofu (broken), xrani (injure), marxa (mash), zalvi (grind), xaksu (consume)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> chooses/selects x<sub>2</sub> [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(complete set)</font>.
Etymology: ixtar(ar), cuz(en), escox(es), cuna(hi), vibir(ru), cuan(zh)
Example_1: mi nu'o mo'u cuxna le ka zukte ma kau - I haven't yet decided what to do.
Example_2: nandu fa le ka cuxna - It's hard to choose.
Related: jdice (decide), pajni (judge), nelci (fond)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [magnitude] is a unit/degree of/on scale/reference standard x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(si'o)</font> measuring property x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: daraj(ar), dagri(en), grad(es), anc(hi), gradus(ru), du(zh)
Example_1: le centi be le mitre cu gradu le ka mitre vau le ka te sepli - Centimeter is a unit on metric scale, which measures distance.
Related: ckilu (scale), kantu (quantum), kelvo (kelvin), merli (measure), ranti (soft), selci (cell)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a bank owned by/in banking system x<sub>2</sub> for banking function<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font>.
Etymology: bank(ar), bank(en), bank(es), bank(hi), bank(ru), iinxan(zh)
Example_1: ti banxa le gugde le ka canja fo le kagni i je to'u ti banxa fi tu'a le kagni - This bank owned by state works with companies, in short, this is a commercial bank.
Related: sorcu (hold), zarci (market), canja (exchange), kagni (company)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an amount of cloth/fabric of type/material x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: kumac(ar), klat(en), pan(es), kapna(hi), sukno(ru), bu(zh)
Example_1: le bukpu cu cpana le jubme - The cloth is on the table.
Related: mapni (cotton), matli (linen), sunla (wool), slasi (plastic), silka (silk)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an end/finish/termination of thing/process x<sub>2</sub>; [not necessarily implying completeness].
Etymology: xitam(ar), fainl(en), fin(es), ant(hi), kaniets(ru), mo(zh)
Example_1: do te mukti le ka mo ca le fanmo le ca jeftu - What are you going to do on weekend?
Example_2: le fanmo be le mi'u te jivna ba cinri ba'a - I expect the final part of the competition interesting.
Related: cfari (happen), sisti (cease), krasi (origin), mulno (complete), denpa (wait), jipno (tip), traji (best)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects Iraqi culture/nationality in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.
x<sub>1</sub> is in/inside/within x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is on the inside/interior of x<sub>2</sub> [totally within the bounds of x<sub>2</sub>].
Etymology: fi(ar), inr(en), en(es), men(hi), vnutri(ru), nei(zh)
Example_1: rau finpe cu nenri le vi rirxe - There are plenty of fish in this river.
Example_2: le mi'u ctuca pu klama le nenri - The teacher came in.
Related: se, vasru (contain), jbini (between), zvati (at), cpana (upon), sruri (surround), senta (layer), snuji (sandwich), bartu (out), diklo (local), jibni (near), jinru (immersed), setca (insert)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(du'u)</font> is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute.
Etymology: xakik(ar), fakt(en), ec(es), tat(hi), fakt(ru), ci(zh)
Example_1: mi se la'u li me'i ro birti le mi'u du'u ro se djuno be mi bei le mi'u munje cu fatci - I'm not completely sure that all that I know about the world are actual facts.
Related: datni (data), jitfa (false), xanri (imaginary), jetnu (true), fasnu (event), zasti (exist), cfika (fiction), saske (lore)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is/acts as a friend of/to x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(experiencer)</font>; x<sub>2</sub> befriends x<sub>1</sub>.
Etymology: rafik(ar), frend(en), amig(es), dost(hi), druk(ru), pen(zh)
Example_1: xu la alis cu pendo do - Is Alice your friend?
Related: bradi (enemy), xendo (kind), nelci (fond), prami (love), bradi (enemy)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead <span class="word-kind">(Pb)</font>; [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].
Etymology: rasis(ar), led(en), plom(es), sisak(hi), svinies(ru), cian(zh)
Example_1: ra pu troci le ka zbasu le solji le cnisa - He tried to make gold out of lead.
Related: jinme (metal), tinci (tin)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a breeze/wind/gale from direction x<sub>2</sub> with speed x<sub>3</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> blows from x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: nasim(ar), briz(en), bris(es), samir(hi), briz(ru), fen(zh)
Example_1: oi le brife be lo'e berti se la'u li du'e carmi - Oh, the northern wind is too strong.
Related: tcima (weather)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(agent)</font> invests resources x<sub>2</sub> in investment x<sub>3</sub> expecting return/profit x<sub>4</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object(s)</font>/event).
Etymology: istatmar(ar), invest(en), invert(es), nivec(hi), vlaj(ru), teuzi(zh)
Example_1: ra pu zivle le jdini le ka sidju pa cnino sanga - He invested money in a new singer.
Example_2: ai mi zivle le nejni le ka prami do vau le nu do prami mi - I take a chance on loving you so that you will love me.
Related: prali (gain), canja (exchange), jbera (borrow), dejni (owe), ponse (possess)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> steps/treads on/in surface x<sub>2</sub> using limbs x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: xatn(ar), step(en), pas(es), par(hi), stup(ru), tabu(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u xirma pu jundi stapa le bisli le sufti - The horse carefully stepped on the ice with her hoofs.
Example_2: mi pu stapa se ka'a le mi'u cripu - I stepped to the bridge.
Related: bajra (run), plipe (jump), cadzu (walk), skalera

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is the weight of object x<sub>2</sub> in [gravitational or other force] field x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: tikal(ar), ueit(en), pesantes(es), taul(hi), vies(ru), jun(zh)
Example_1: le gunka pe le kensa cu se junta le ki'ogra be li pa no no le mi'u terdi - The space worker weights 100 kilograms in the gravity of the Earth.
Related: grake (gram), linto (lightweight), tilju (heavy), bunda (pound)

Definition: <span class="word-kind">(adjective:)</font> x<sub>1</sub> is fresh/unspoiled.
Etymology: tazaj(ar), frec(en), fresk(es), navin(hi), sviej(ru), cian(zh)
Example_1: xu le mi'u finpe cu vifne - Is the fish fresh?
Related: fusra (rotten)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> becomes/changes/converts/transforms into x<sub>2</sub> under conditions x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: inkalab(ar), bikam(en), asers(es), xo(hi), dien(ru), bian(zh)
Example_1: le tsiju ba zi binxo lo tricu - The seed soon will turn into a tree.
Related: cenba (vary), galfi (modify), stika (adjust), zasni (temporary)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a highly reflective/polished non-tarnishing metallic surface, of metal x<sub>2</sub> [often chromium].
Etymology: krom(ar), krom(en), krom(es), krom(hi), xrom(ru), ge(zh)
Example_1: pa verba ne se pi'o le degji pu pencu le romge be le mi'u karce - A child touched the reflecting surface of the car with his finger.
Related: jinme (metal)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> bites/pinches x<sub>2</sub> on/at specific locus x<sub>3</sub> with x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: kasam(ar), bait(en), mord(es), kat(hi), kus(ru), ci(zh)
Example_1: pu ku pa gerku cu batci le tuple be mi - A dog bit my leg.
Related: denci (tooth), jgalu (claw), guska (scrape), citka (eat)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(set/mass/ind.)</font> is miscellaneous/various/assorted in property x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font>.
Etymology: cata(ar), varias(en), varios(es), vivid(hi), razlicn(ru), ci(zh)
Example_1: le za'u vi mlatu cu vrici le ka skari ma kau - These cats vary in color.
Related: vrici (assorted), klesi (category), girzu (group), frica (differ), simsa (similar), panra (parallel)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> knows fact<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(du'u)</font> about subject x<sub>3</sub> by epistemology x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: alim(ar), no(en), konos(es), jan(hi), zna(ru), dun(zh)
Example_1: mi djuno le mi'u du'u mi zasti vau fo le mi'u du'u mi pensi - I know that I exist since I think.
Example_2: mi djuno so'i da la lojban - I know a lot about Lojban.
Related: krici (believe), jinvi (opine), cilre (learn), certu (competent), facki (discover), jijnu (intuit), jimpe (understand), senpi (doubt), smadi (guess), kakne (able), birti (certain), mipri (secret), morji (remember), saske (lore), viska (see)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force x<sub>2</sub> under conditions x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: jamid(ar), xard(en), dur(es), kar(hi), tviord(ru), jian(zh)
Example_1: le cilmo mudri cu jdari le ka jelca - Wet wood is resistant to burning.
Related: nandu (difficult), ralci (delicate), fapro (oppose), ranti (soft), tinsa (stiff), toltinsa, sligu (solid), stodi (constant)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is free/at liberty to do/be x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state)</font> under conditions x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: xur(ar), fri(en), libr(es), svatantr(hi), svabodn(ru), zieu(zh)
Example_1: mi zifre le ka zukte le se nelci be mi - I am free to do what I like.
Related: pinfu (prisoner), rinju (restrain), bilga (must), e'ande, kakne (able), frili (easy)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a/the language/dialect used by x<sub>2</sub> to express/communicate x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(si'o/du'u, not quote)</font>.
Etymology: lisan(ar), languij(en), lengu(es), bac(hi), iizik(ru), iuian(zh)
Example_1: xu do se bangu la lojban - Do you speak Lojban?
Example_2: le mi'u nanmu pu pilno le bangu be fi le mabla - The man used foul language.
Related: tance (tongue), cusku (express), ve, tavla (talk), valsi (word), gerna (grammar), jufra (sentence), natmi (nation), slaka (syllable)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> logically necessitates/entails/implies action/event/state x<sub>2</sub> under rules/logic system x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: tatalaba(ar), enteil(en), implik(es), anivaria(hi), vavlik(ru), cibicu(zh)
Example_1: da zo'u le ka djica da cu nibli le ka claxu da - Wanting something implies lacking it.
Example_2: le ka frili na nibli le ka xamgu - Being easy doesn't imply that it is good.
Related: natfe (contradict), rinka (cause), mukti (motive), krinu (reason), ni'i, jalge (result), logji (logic)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> translates text/utterance x<sub>2</sub> to language x<sub>3</sub> from language x<sub>4</sub> with translation result x<sub>5</sub>.
Etymology: tarjam(ar), tranzleit(en), tradus(es), anuvad(hi), pirivad(ru), fan(zh)
Example_1: mi pu fanva lu coi ui li'u le glico le lojbo zoi gy.yay, hello!.gy. - I translated {coi ui} to English from Lojban as "Yay, hello!"
Example_2: xu lu coi do li'u drani xe fanva zoi gy.Hello, you!.gy. - Is {coi do} a correct translation of ‘Hello, you!’?
Related: cusku (express), bangu (language), traduki

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a station/node of/in/on transport/communication/distribution system/network x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: maxata(ar), steicn(en), parad(es), stecan(hi), stansii(ru), jan(zh)
Example_1: ti tcana le trene - This is a train station.
Related: dargu (road), litru (travel), pluta (path), trene (train), ciste (system), mrilu (mail), tivni (television), cradi (radio), benji (send), fonxa (telephone), letri, fatri (distribute)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of x<sub>2</sub> in form/medium x<sub>3</sub> made by method x<sub>4</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font>.
Etymology: taklid(ar), kapi(en), kopi(es), nakal(hi), kopi(ru), fu(zh)
Example_1: mi ralte pa fukpi be ti noi pixra bei pa bukpu pe le jubme bei le nu prina - I have a printed copy of this picture made as a tablecloth.
Related: krefu (recur), rapli (repeat), gidva (conduct), zi'evla

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition x<sub>2</sub> in form/arrangement x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: bilaur(ar), kristl(en), kristal(es), kristal(hi), kristal(ru), cueijin(zh)
Example_1: ti du le za'u krili be le silna - These are the crystals of salt.
Related: jemna (gem), bisli (ice)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font> often/frequently/commonly/customarily occurs/recurs by standard x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: katir(ar), afn(en), frekont(es), anekac(hi), cast(ru), can(zh)
Example_1: .i mutce cafne fa le nu mi vitke le patfu be mi - It's quite often that I visit my father.
Related: rirci (rare), fadni (ordinary), kampu (common), rapli (repeat), krefu (recur), lakne (likely), so'i, roi

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is x<sub>2</sub> hours in duration <span class="word-kind">(default is 1 hour)</font> by standard x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: saa(ar), aur(en), ora(es), xora(hi), cas(ru), ciauc(zh)
Example_1: lo'e nicte be le cabna bei ti cu cacra li mu - At this time and this place, night is 5 hours long.
Related: junla (clock), mentu (minute), snidu (second), tcika (time of day), temci (time)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is thin in direction/dimension x<sub>2</sub> by standard x<sub>3</sub>; [relatively short in smallest dimension].
Etymology: naxil(ar), tin(en), flak(es), patla(hi), tonk(ru), ci(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u ninmu cu cinla le ka se tuple - The woman has thin legs.
Related: rotsu (thick), jarki (narrow), tordu (short), cmalu (small), caxno (shallow), plana (fat), jarki (narrow)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> turns about vector x<sub>2</sub> towards direction x<sub>3</sub>, turning angular distance / to face point x<sub>4</sub>
Etymology: adar(ar), trn(en), rod(es), cakra(hi), pavaraciv(ru), cuan(zh)
Example_1: ko carna fi le pritu - Turn to the right.
Example_2: ko carna fi le pritu - Turn right.
Related: gunro (roll), jendu (axle)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile x<sub>2</sub>, propelled by x<sub>3</sub> [propellant/propulsion].
Etymology: kadafa(ar), lanc(en), ec(es), cala(hi), stril(ru), ce(zh)
Example_1: ti cecla le fagri - This is a fire gun.
Related: renro (throw), danti (projectile), jakne (rocket), jbama (bomb), spoja (explode)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among x<sub>2</sub> with shares/portions x<sub>3</sub>; <span class="word-kind">(x<sub>2</sub>/x<sub>3</sub> fa'u)</font>.
Etymology: farak(ar), distribiut(en), distrib(es), vitran(hi), raspridil(ru), fa(zh)
Example_1: gau mi fatri fa le titla le verba le pa mei - I handed out candies to children one candy to each of them.
Related: fa'u, fendi (divide), preja (spread), katna (cut), tcana (station)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> governs/rules/is ruler/governor/sovereign/reigns over people/territory/domain/subjects x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: xakam(ar), gavrn(en), govern(es), casan(hi), prav(ru), tunji(zh)
Example_1: ra turni le bu'u gugde - He governs this country.
Related: catni (authority), minde (command), tutra (territory), jecta (polity), gugde (country), ponse (possess), jitro (control)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects Urdu language/culture/nationality in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.
x<sub>1</sub> is group/cluster/team showing common property <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font> x<sub>2</sub> due to set x<sub>3</sub> linked by relations x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: firk(ar), grup(en), grup(es), set(hi), grup(ru), zu(zh)
Example_1: mi cmima lo girzu be le ka tadni la lojban - I belong to a group of those who learn Lojban.
Related: bende (association), ciste (system), cmima (belong to), gunma (jointly), panra (parallel), cabra (apparatus), cecmu (community), kansa (with), klesi (category), lanzu (family), liste (list), vrici (assorted)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(default 1)</font> short local distance unit<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> [non-metric], standard x<sub>3</sub>, x<sub>4</sub> subunits.
Etymology: guz(ar), fut(en), pie(es), guz(hi), fut(ru), ci(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; x<sub>1</sub> is a disk/circle/ring.
Etymology: dair(ar), srkl(en), redond(es), cakar(hi), krukl(ru), cuan(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u lunra noi pelxu gi'e cukla gi'e carmi cu zvati le tsani - The Moon, yellow, round and bright, is in the sky.
Related: djine (ring), ranji (continue), bolci (ball), tarmi (shape)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> owes x<sub>2</sub> in debt/obligation to creditor x<sub>3</sub> in return for x<sub>4</sub> [service, loan]; x<sub>1</sub> is a debtor.
Etymology: dain(ar), det(en), deb(es), dendar(hi), doljn(ru), jai(zh)
Example_1: mi dejni le ka sidju vau do le ka se sidju do - I am obliged to help you in return for your help.
Example_2: mi dejni fi le patfu be mi fo le ka snada - I owe my success to my father.
Related: jbera (borrow), janta (account), zivle (invest)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a blade/expanse of grass of species x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: ueba(ar), gras(en), ierb(es), gas(hi), trava(ru), sau(zh)
Example_1: lo'e bakni cu jai sarcu fai tu'a le'e srasu - Cows need grass.
Related: spati (plant)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(agent)</font> asserts/claims/declares x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(du'u)</font> is true [can be used for epistemology of authority].
Etymology: sarax(ar), asrt(en), deklar(es), balpurvak(hi), zaiavl(ru), xuan(zh)
Example_1: le djuno be le zmadu cu xusra le se zmadu - Who knows more claims less.
Example_2: xu do xusra le mi'u du'u le mi'u terdi cu carna le mi'u solri - Are you asserting that the Earth goes round the Sun?
Related: natfe (contradict), nupre (promise)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is black/extremely dark-colored [color adjective].
Etymology: asuad(ar), blak(en), negr(es), kricn(hi), ciarn(ru), xei(zh)

Related: blabi (white), grusi (gray), manku (dark), skari (color), xekri (black), kandi (dim), carmi (intense), blanu (blue), bunre (brown), cicna (cyan), crino (green), narju (orange), nukni (magenta), pelxu (yellow), xunre (red), zirpu (purple)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> satisfies evaluator x<sub>2</sub> in property <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font>/state x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: akna(ar), satisfai(en), satisfas(es), prasan(hi), udavlitvar(ru), man(zh)
Example_1: le zdani be mi cu mansa mi le ka tcini bu'u ce'u - I'm satisfied with the conditions in my house.

Definition: 1st assignable variable predicate <span class="word-kind">(context determines place structure)</font>.
Example_1: mi pu klama cei broda le zarci i ba bo mi ze'a sipna i xu do ba broda - I went to the market, and then I slept. Will you go to the market?

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> sows/plants x<sub>2</sub> [crop/plants] at/in x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: zara(ar), so(en), sembr(es), bona(hi), zasiv(ru), bo(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a letter/missive/[note] to intended audience x<sub>2</sub> from author/originator x<sub>3</sub> with content x<sub>4</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> supports/holds up/is underpinning of/[helps] x<sub>2</sub> against force/opposition x<sub>3</sub> with/by means x<sub>4</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object/state)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a rose [flower - characterized by prickly stem/fragrance] of species/strain x<sub>2</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is ready/prepared for x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [individual or mass of hard surfaces] grinds/pulverizes/crushes x<sub>2</sub> into powder x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary x<sub>2</sub> from x<sub>3</sub> in property/amount x<sub>4</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka/ni)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> dwells/lives/resides/abides at/inhabits/is a resident of location/habitat/nest/home/abode x<sub>2</sub>.

x<sub>1</sub> is a rod/pole/staff/stick/cane [shape/form] of material x<sub>2</sub>.

Example_1: ra pu jgari pa grana - He was holding a rod.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is friction [force opposing motion] due to contact/rubbing between x<sub>2</sub> and x<sub>3</sub>; <span class="word-kind">(fe)</font> x<sub>2</sub> rubs x<sub>3</sub>.

Related: sakli (slide), sraku (scratch), jabre (brake), satre (stroke), guska (scrape), pencu (touch), spali (polish)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is winter/wintertime [cold season] of year x<sub>2</sub> at location x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: cita(ar), uintr(en), inviern(es), jara(hi), zima(ru), dun(zh)

Etymology: jauka(ar), band(en), band(es), bend(hi), orkestr(ru), iueduei(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a structure/arrangement/organization of x<sub>2</sub> [set/system/complexity].

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a donkey/jackass of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is energy of type x<sub>2</sub> in form x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: taka(ar), enrji(en), enerxi(es), tej(hi), iniergii(ru), nen(zh)

Etymology: dil(ar), ceid(en), sombr(es), cai(hi), tien(ru), iin(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects Canadian culture/nationality in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(agent)</font> digs x<sub>2</sub> [material] up/out of x<sub>3</sub> [source/hole] with limbs/tool<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>4</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a cat/[puss/pussy/kitten] [feline animal] of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>; <span class="word-kind">(adjective:)</font> x<sub>1</sub> is feline.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a record of x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(data/facts/du'u)</font> about x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object/event)</font> preserved in medium x<sub>4</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/action/state)</font> is severe/harsh to x<sub>2</sub> [victim/experiencer].

Etymology: taxakum(ar), airni(en), ironi(es), viangia(hi), ironi(ru), fanxua(zh)
Example_1: zo co'oi poi do pu cusku cu ranxi le ka se smuni zo coi vau le ka se smuni zo co'o - "Chao" that you said was ironic in that instead of meaning "Hi!" it actually meant "Bye!"

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an heir to/is to inherit x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object/quality)</font> from x<sub>3</sub> according to rule x<sub>4</sub>.

Example_1: le mi'u nu jamna cu mokca po'o le remna citri - The war is just a point in human history.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(experiencer)</font> increases/is incremented/augmented in property/quantity x<sub>2</sub> by amount x<sub>3</sub>.

Example_1: mi zenba le ka se cfipu vau so'i da - My confusion increased a lot.

Example_1: le cipni poi ca'o vofli cu galtu mi lei cmana - To me the flying bird is high above the mountains.
Related: gapru (above), dizlo (low), cnita (below), drudi (roof), farna (direction)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is automatic in function x<sub>2</sub> under conditions x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: utumatiki(ar), atamatik(en), automatik(es), apaseap(hi), aftamaticesk(ru), zidun(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u vorme cu zmiku le ka co'a kalri - The door opens automatically.
Related: macnu (manual)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(force)</font> folds/creases x<sub>2</sub> at locus/loci/forming crease<span class="word-kind">(s)</font>/bend<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: taua(ar), fold(en), pleg(es), valit(hi), skladiv(ru), je(zh)
Example_1: mi pu polje pa boxfo so'i da - I wrinkled the sheet of paper in several places.
Related: korcu (bent), cinje (wrinkle), boxfo (sheet), boxna (wave)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is superlative in property x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font>, the x<sub>3</sub> extreme <span class="word-kind">(ka; default ka zmadu)</font> among set/range x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: mutatarif(ar), ekstrim(en), ekstrem(es), atiadik(hi), krain(ru), ji(zh)
Example_1: la alis cu traji le ka clani vau le nixli pe ti noi ckule - Alice is the tallest among girls of this school.
Related: rai, jimte (limit), milxe (mild), mutce (extreme), banli (great), curve (pure), fanmo (end), krasi (origin), manfo (uniform), prane (ideal), zmadu (exceed), mleca (less)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(evt./state)</font> interferes with/hinders/disrupts x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(evt./state/process)</font> due to quality x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font>.
Etymology: xaca(ar), intrfir(en), interfer(es), viatikarn(hi), sriv(ru), zu(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u gerku cu zunti le nu mi lumci le kumfa vau le ka plipe - The dog leaping hinders me from cleaning the room.
Related: fanta (block), dicra (interrupt), fliba (fail), fanza (annoy), raktu (trouble), klina (clear), bandu (defend), cfipu (confusing), ganlo (closed)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment for function x<sub>2</sub> controlled/[triggered] by x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(agent)</font>.
Etymology: jixaz(ar), aparatas(en), aparat(es), iantra(hi), aparat(ru), cebei(zh)
Example_1: ti cabra le ka zalvi le gurni vau le xance - This is a hand-controlled machine for grinding grain.
Related: tutci (instrument), minji (machine), finti (compose), girzu (group), ganzu (arrange), pilno (use)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: aial(ar), dir(en), sierv(es), mrig(hi), alien(ru), mi(zh)
Example_1: co'a le ka jbena vau le mirli cu kakne le ka sanli - A baby deer can stand as soon as it is born.
Related: mabru (mammal), danlu (animal)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a/the wing [body-part] of x<sub>2</sub>; [metaphor: lateral supporting surface].
Etymology: janax(ar), uin(en), al(es), pakc(hi), krilo(ru), ci(zh)
Example_1: le nalci be le mi'u cipni cu spofu - The bird has its wing broken.
Related: cipni (bird), pimlu (feather), rebla (tail)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is neutral/not taking sides/medial/not towards any extreme on scale/in dissension x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: xiadi(ar), nutrl(en), neutral(es), tatac(hi), niitraln(ru), junli(zh)
Example_1: la lojban cu nutli le ka ma kau mapti ce'u le ka traji fi le kulnu - Lojban is neutral in terms of what culture matches it best.
Related: midju (center), lanxe (balance), milxe (mild), mutce (extreme), no'e

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is stiff/rigid/inflexible/resistant in direction x<sub>2</sub> against force x<sub>3</sub> under conditions x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: salib(ar), stif(en), ties(es), sakt(hi), jiostk(ru), iin(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u falnu cu tinsa le pinta le mi'u brife - The sail is rigid in horizontal direction against the wind.
Related: toltinsa, bapli (effective), jdari (firm), nandu (difficult), torni (twist), trati (taut), xarnu (stubborn), danre (press), stodi (constant)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is made of/contains/is a quantity of silver/argentum <span class="word-kind">(Ag)</font>; [metaphor: valuable, tarnishing].
Etymology: fida(ar), arjent(en), arxentos(es), rajat(hi), siribro(ru), iin(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u sicni cu rijno - The coin is silver.
Related: solji (gold)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a plate/dish/platter/saucer [flat/mildly concave food service bed] made of material x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: tabak(ar), pleit(en), plat(es), tal(hi), tarielk(ru), pan(zh)
Example_1: mi pu jai gau porpi fai le palta - I broke a plate.
Example_2: le mi'u palta co'a porpi - The plate got broken.
Related: ckana (bed), palne (tray), kabri (cup), tansi (pan), ckana (bed)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state)</font> seems pleasant to/pleases x<sub>2</sub> under conditions x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: sar(ar), pliz(en), plas(es), tript(hi), ugajd(ru), iukuai(zh)
Example_1: mi se pluka le ka ci'erkei la tenis - I like playing tennis.
Example_2: mi se pluka le ka limna le xamsi - I enjoy swimming in the sea.
Related: rigni (disgusting), melbi (beautiful), nelci (fond), prami (love)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font>.
Etymology: iktimal(ar), matiur(en), madur(es), pak(hi), matior(ru), cu(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u nanmu cu simlu le ka makcu le ka seksi - The man seems to be mature in his sexuality.
Related: cifnu (baby), ninmu (woman), verba (child), banro (grow), farvi (develop), nanmu (man)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
Etymology: kutni(ar), katn(en), algodon(es), kapans(hi), bumajnai(ru), mian(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u mapni cu zabna - The cotton is of high quality.
Related: bukpu (cloth)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> tries/attempts/makes an effort to do/attain x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state/property)</font> by actions/method x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: xaual(ar), trai(en), prob(es), kocic(hi), pit(ru), ci(zh)
Example_1: mi ba troci le ka cpare le mi'u tricu - I will try to climb the tree.
Example_2: le troci ku po'o cu snada i ku'i le troci po'o cu fliba - Only the one who tries succeeds. But the one who only tries fails.
Related: fliba (fail), snada (succeed), cipra (test)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> invents/creates/composes/authors x<sub>2</sub> for function/purpose x<sub>3</sub> from existing elements/ideas x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: ixtira(ar), invent(en), invent(es), sricti(hi), sazdav(ru), famin(zh)
Example_1: mi pu finti pa lisri le ka jai gau zdile le mi'u verba vau le se vedli be mi - I created a story out of my real experience to amuse the child.
Related: ciska (write), pemci (poem), zbasu (build), larcu (art), prosa (prose), skina (cinema)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> carries/hauls/bears/transports cargo x<sub>2</sub> to x<sub>3</sub> from x<sub>4</sub> over path x<sub>5</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is a carrier/[porter].
Etymology: xamal(ar), ber(en), iev(es), dona(hi), nisti(ru), bei(zh)
Example_1: mi pu bevri pa patxu be lo nudle fu'e ta'o fi le purdi fo le kumfa pe le'e nu jukpa vau fu le rokci dargu fu'o - I carried a bowl of noodles (to the garden from the kitchen via a rocky road).
Example_2: la kevin pu bevri pa gerku le zdani - Kevin brought a dog home.
Related: bevri (carry), marce (vehicle), muvdu (move), benji (send), klama (come)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to x<sub>2</sub> for ailment x<sub>3</sub> by treatment/cure x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: tabib(ar), medik(en), medik(es), cikitsak(hi), izliec(ru), iicen(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u mikce pu minde mi le ka sipna - The doctor ordered me to sleep.
Example_2: le mamta be mi pu mikce mi tu'a le bekpi be mi ta'i le ka punji le jduli - My mother treated my ill back by applying an ointment.
Related: bilma (ill), kanro (healthy), spita (hospital)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> judges/referees/arbitrates/is a judge determining/deciding matter x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(abstract)</font>.
Etymology: kadai(ar), jaj(en), xusg(es), narni(hi), sud(ru), pan(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u te cange pu pajni le mi'u du'u xu kau le grute cu makcu - The farmer was deciding whether fruits were ripe.
Related: cuxna (choose), jdice (decide), vajni (important), cipra (test), zekri (crime), manri (reference), mansa (satisfy)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal x<sub>2</sub> mined from location/lode/mine x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: madin(ar), minrl(en), mineral(es), kanij(hi), miniral(ru), kuan(zh)
Example_1: ti kunra le tirse le cmana - This is an iron containing ore mined from mountains.
Related: jinme (metal), bisli (ice), rokci (rock), jemna (gem)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a rule prescribing/mandating/requiring x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state)</font> within system/community x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: kaid(ar), rul(en), regl(es), niam(hi), pravil(ru), jan(zh)
Example_1: mi te javni le ka co'u tavla gi'e co'a jundi - I should stop talking and start listening.
Example_2: e'u zukte le javni be le ka di'i retsku - I suggest you follow the rule or regularly asking questions.
Related: flalu (law), ritli (rite), marde (morals), tcaci (custom), tinbe (obey), zekri (crime)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: mijrafa(ar), cavl(en), pal(es), pavra(hi), lapat(ru), can(zh)
Example_1: ti canpa lo'e dertu ji lo'e snime - Is this spade for digging ground or snow?
Related: kakpa (dig), guska (scrape), tutci (instrument)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(person)</font> feels/has pride in/about x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(abstraction)</font>.
Etymology: naxa(ar), praid(en), enorguies(es), gaurav(hi), gordast(ru), jiau(zh)
Example_1: mi jgira le nu do co'a kakne le ka zgipli le pipno - I am proud that you are now able to play the piano.
Related: cinmo (emotion), cumla (humble), sevzi (self), sinma (esteem), snada (succeed)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a drop [small, cohesive shape] of material [liquid/vapor] x<sub>2</sub> in surrounding material x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: katar(ar), drop(en), got(es), bund(hi), kapli(ru), di(zh)
Example_1: sa'u ti dirgo le djacu - It's just a drop of water.
Related: daplu (island), bidju (bead)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a sibling of x<sub>2</sub> by bond/tie/standard/parent<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: rabia(ar), vernl(en), primaver(es), vasant(hi), visna(ru), cuen(zh)
Example_1: do tunba mi le ka se mamta gi'e se patfu - You are my sibling since we are born from the same mother and father.
Related: bruna (brother), mensi (sister), tamne (cousin)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention x<sub>2</sub>.
Example_1: lu li vo du li re su'i re li'u mekso la lojban - {li vo du li resu'i re} is a mathematical expression in Lojban.
Example_2: zoi cy.(x+15&~15).cy. mekso le bangu poi du la c - "(x+15&~15)" is a mathematical expression in C language.
Related: cmaci (mathematics), dilcu (quotient), fancu (function), frinu (fraction), jalge (result), namcu (number), parbi (rate), pilji (multiply)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is the exponential result of base x<sub>2</sub> to power/exponent x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: kua(ar), eksponencl(en), eksponent(es), gatank(hi), stiepin(ru), cenfan(zh)
Example_1: li so tenfa li ci li re - 9 is the exponential result of 3 to the power 2.
Related: dugri (logarithm)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an ant of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: namla(ar), ant(en), ormig(es), cinta(hi), muravie(ru), maii(zh)
Example_1: le sakta cu trina le manti - Sugar attracts ants.
Related: cinki (insect), blato

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] x<sub>2</sub> in matter<span class="word-kind">(s)</font>/function<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: matal(ar), praksi(en), represent(es), pratinid(hi), pritstavl(ru), kai(zh)
Example_1: pa krati be le turni bei le ka ckini fi le gubni co'a tavla lei mi'u se natmi - A representative of the governor in public relations started talking to the nation.
Related: jansu (diplomat), catni (authority), vipsi (deputy), pulji (police)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is magenta/fuchsia/purplish-red [color adjective].
Etymology: kirmiz(ar), fuksin(en), fuksi(es), bagani(hi), fuksin(ru), ianxun(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u pa xrula cu nukni - The flower has a magenta color.
Related: skari (color), blabi (white), xekri (black), kandi (dim), carmi (intense), xunre (red), zirpu (purple)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is sharp/keen at locus x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: takib(ar), kin(en), agud(es), paina(hi), ostr(ru), li(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u balre cu kinli le jipno - The tip of the blade is sharp.
Related: balre (blade), dakfu (knife), jesni (needle)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a current/flow/river of/in x<sub>2</sub> flowing in direction to/towards x<sub>3</sub> from direction/source x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: jaraian(ar), flo(en), flu(es), bax(hi), tiec(ru), lieu(zh)
Example_1: ti flecu le condi pa lalxu pa galtu krasi pe bu'u lei cmana - This is a current in a deep bed running towards a lake from high springheads in the mountains.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: nuxas(ar), bras(en), laton(es), pital(hi), latun(ru), xuantun(zh)
Example_1: le lastu cu mixre le tunka joi le zinki - Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc.
Related: jinme (metal), ransu (bronze), tunka (copper)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of soya [grain/bean] of species/strain x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: soja(ar), soi(en), sox(es), soiabin(hi), soi(ru), deu(zh)
Example_1: ti stasu le sobde - This is a soya soup.
Related: dembi (bean), gurni (grain)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting x<sub>2</sub> from danger/threat x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: maxba(ar), xarbr(en), ampar(es), acrai(hi), priiut(ru), bi(zh)
Example_1: mi pu jai se bapli fai le ka se marbi pa laldo dinju fi le ka cilmo - I had to take shelter in an old building in order not to become wet.
Related: zdani (nest), dinju (building), bandu (defend), ckape (peril), snura (safe), drudi (roof), sepli (apart), bitmu (wall), gacri (cover)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is concave within x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>2</sub> is hollow at locus x<sub>1</sub>.
Etymology: kaxf(ar), keiv(en), kov(es), kandra(hi), picier(ru), ken(zh)
Example_1: da kevna le mi'u drudi - There is a hole in the roof.
Related: fenra (crack), kunti (empty), canlu (space), canko (window), galxe (throat), tubnu (tube)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is old/familiar/well-known to observer x<sub>2</sub> in feature x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font> by standard x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: ajuz(ar), old(en), viex(es), bur(hi), star(ru), lau(zh)
Example_1: mi na se slabu la kevin - I'm not familiar with Kevin.
Example_2: la alis cu slabu mi le ka jukpa le kukte torta - Alice is familiar to me in cooking tasty cakes.
Related: fange (alien), clani (long), citno (young), cnino (new), se, djuno (know)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects British/United Kingdom culture/nationality in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.
x<sub>1</sub> thirsts for x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> needs/wants drink/fluid/lubrication x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: atac(ar), trst(en), sed(es), pias(hi), jajd(ru), ke(zh)
Example_1: mi taske - I'm thirsty.
Example_2: mi mutce taske le jisra - I'm dying for a juice!
Related: nitcu (need), djica (desire), xagji (be hungry), pinxe (drink)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a pulley [tool] for performing action/function x<sub>2</sub> rotating on axle x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: tanbur(ar), puli(en), pole(es), girni(hi), ckif(ru), xualun(zh)
Example_1: ti pulni le nu cpacu le djacu le mi'u jinto vau le mudri - This is a wooden pulley to lift water from the well.
Related: tutci (instrument), xislu (wheel), vraga (lever)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an office/bureau/work-place of worker x<sub>2</sub> at location x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: dair(ar), biuro(en), ofisin(es), karialai(hi), biuro(ru), ju(zh)
Example_1: ti briju le mikce le tcadu - This is the doctor's city office.
Related: jibri (job), gunka (work)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is x<sub>2</sub> months in duration <span class="word-kind">(default is 1 month)</font> by month standard x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: caxr(ar), mant(en), mes(es), mas(hi), miesiis(ru), iue(zh)
Example_1: le lidne dunra cu masti li ci - The past winter lasted for 3 months.
Related: detri (date), djedi (full day), jeftu (week), nanca (year)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is 10^{-21} of x<sub>2</sub> in dimension/aspect x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(default is units)</font>.
Example_1: le xa no re selci be le marji cu zepti le molro le ka se canlu - One zeptomole (zmol) of substance contains 602 particles.
Related: centi (.01)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a skirt/kilt/dress of material x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is skirted [garment open at the bottom; not legged].
Etymology: tanur(ar), skrt(en), sai(es), skart(hi), iubk(ru), ciun(zh)
Example_1: mi pu te vecnu pa tordu skaci - I bought a short skirt.
Related: taxfu (garment), palku (pants)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a brush for purpose x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font> with bristles x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: furca(ar), brac(en), broc(es), burus(hi), ciotka(ru), cua(zh)
Example_1: ti burcu le nu punji le cinta vau lei cmalu - This is a brush for painting with small bristles.
Related: kombitu, pinsi (pencil)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is honest/open/truthfully revealing to/candid/frank with x<sub>2</sub> about matter/fact x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: mustakim(ar), anast(en), onest(es), sac(hi), ceistn(ru), cen(zh)
Example_1: ko stace mi le ka pu smusku le nu do pu zukte ma kau - Be honest with me in saying what you did.
Example_2: sei mi stace mi na djuno - Frankly, I don't know.
Related: tcica (deceive), jetnu (true), jitfa (false), mipri (secret)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of/contains/is made of made of metal of composition including x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: madin(ar), metl(en), metal(es), datu(hi), mital(ru), jin(zh)
Example_1: ti noi grana cu jinme - This rod is metallic.
Example_2: le slami cu daspo le jinme - Acid destroys metal.
Related: cnisa (lead), gasta (steel), lastu (brass), margu (mercury), nikle (nickel), ransu (bronze), romge (chrome), sodna (sodium), tinci (tin), tirse (iron), tunka (copper), zinki (zinc), kunra (mineral), sodva (soda)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a/the body organ [body-part] of body/species x<sub>2</sub> performing function x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: udu(ar), orgn(en), organ(es), ang(hi), organ(ru), guan(zh)
Example_1: le risna cu sluji rango fi le ka pambe le ciblu vi'u le xadni - The heart is the muscular organ that pumps blood throughout the body.
Example_2: ti rango le insekto le ka tirna - This is an organ of insects performing the function of listening.
Related: besna (brain), livga (liver)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an elephant of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: fil(ar), elafnt(en), elefant(es), xat(hi), slon(ru), cian(zh)
Example_1: le xanto cu se nazbi le clani - Elephants have long noses.
Related: mabru (mammal), barda (big)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a chair/stool/seat/bench, a piece or portion of a piece of furniture intended for sitting.
Etymology: kursi(ar), stul(en), sii(es), kurs(hi), stul(ru), iiz(zh)
Example_1: e'a do jai gau muvdu fai le mi'u stizu ti gi'e zutse - Feel free to move the chair here and be seated.
Related: nilce (furniture), zutse (sit), jubme (table), ckana (bed)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a rabbit/hare/[doe] of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: arnab(ar), rabit(en), liebr(es), cac(hi), krolik(ru), tu(zh)
Example_1: le ractu zi co'a se panzi - Rabbits breed quickly.
Related: mabru (mammal), kerlo (ear)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(mass)</font> is a committee with task/purpose x<sub>2</sub> of body x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: lajna(ar), kamiti(en), komite(es), kameti(hi), kamisi(ru), ueiiuanxuei(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u kamni be le ka jai gau farvi le mi'u bangu cu gunma za'u pa no prenu - There are more than 10 members in the committee for developing the language.
Related: bende (association), kagni (company)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an era/epoch/age characterized by x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/property/interval/idea)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is brown/tan [color adjective].

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a restaurant/cafe/diner serving type-of-food x<sub>2</sub> to audience x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is angry/mad at x<sub>2</sub> for x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(action/state/property)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font> is complete/done/finished; x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object)</font> has become whole in property x<sub>2</sub> by standard x<sub>3</sub>.

Related: djuno (know), facki (discover), jijnu (intuit), sruma (assume)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a melon/squash [fruit/plant] of species/strain x<sub>2</sub>.

x<sub>1</sub> [agent] shoves/pushes x<sub>2</sub> at locus x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a pig/hog/swine/[boar] [pork/ham/bacon-producer] of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is encoded/cipher text of plain-text x<sub>2</sub> by code/coding system x<sub>3</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is in code; x<sub>3</sub> is a code.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> chases/pursues/<span class="word-kind">(physically)</font> follows after x<sub>2</sub>; volition is not implied for x<sub>1</sub> or x<sub>2</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> errs in doing/being/making mistake x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font>, an error under conditions x<sub>3</sub> by standard x<sub>4</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is grateful/thankful to/appreciative of x<sub>2</sub> for x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/property)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quotient of 'x<sub>2</sub>/x<sub>3</sub>' [dividend x<sub>2</sub> divided by divisor x<sub>3</sub>], leaving remainder x<sub>4</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a weapon/arms for use against x<sub>2</sub> by x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a deputy/vice/subordinate in aspect [or organization principle] x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font> to principal x<sub>3</sub>.

Example_1: mi nelci le sanso be le nudle bei le tamca - I like tomato sauce in noodles.

Example_1: ra pu mo'u cpare le mi'u cmana - She has climbed on the mountain.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object/event)</font> is good/beneficial/nice/[acceptable] for x<sub>2</sub> by standard x<sub>3</sub>.

Example_1: ba zi ku mi se xamgu - Soon I'll be okay.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a passport issued to x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(person)</font> by authority x<sub>3</sub> allowing x<sub>4</sub> <span class="word-kind">(activity)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object)</font> moves to destination/receiver x<sub>2</sub> [away] from origin x<sub>3</sub> over path/route x<sub>4</sub>.

Related: rinci (drain), klama (come), litru (travel), cliva (leave), fatri (distribute), dunda (give), benji (send), preja (spread), bevri (carry), vimcu (delete)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> celebrates/recognizes/honors x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/abstract)</font> with activity/[party] x<sub>3</sub>.

Example_1: mi pu salci le nu mi jai nanca li pa no vau le ka litru la nipon - I celebrated my 10th birthday by travelling to Japan.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an evening [from end-of-work until sleep typical for locale] of day x<sub>2</sub> at location x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a woman/women; x<sub>1</sub> is a female humanoid person [not necessarily adult].

Example_1: pa melbi ninmu poi se kerfa le pelxu pu cadzu bu'u le mi'u panka - A pretty woman with yellow hair was walking in the park.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali/base of composition including x<sub>2</sub>.

Example_1: mi pu lumci le palta se pi'o le jilka be le sodna - I washed dishes using soda.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a daughter of mother/father/parents x<sub>2</sub>; [not necessarily biological].

Example_1: ma nuzba le tixnu be do - How is your daughter?

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(person)</font> decides/makes decision x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(du'u)</font> about matter x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state)</font>.
Etymology: karar(ar), disaid(en), desid(es), nicai(hi), ric(ru), jiue(zh)
Example_1: mi mo'u jdice le mi'u du'u sarcu fa le nu mi'a stali - I decided that we need to stay.
Example_2: xu do jdice le ka jai se kufra vau le zdani be do - Have you decided that your home is comfortable?
Related: pajni (judge), cuxna (choose), manri (reference)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font> is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; x<sub>1</sub> is an incident/happening/occurrence.

Example_1: le cizra pu va fasnu - There were strange things happening there.

Example_1: xu le tunka cu narju - Is copper orange?

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is equal/congruent to/as much as x<sub>2</sub> in property/dimension/quantity x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: muadil(ar), ikual(en), igual(es), tuli(hi), ravn(ru), den(zh)
Example_1: mi dunli le mensi be mi le ka clani i ku'i mi na mintu le mi'u mensi - I am as long as my sister is. But I'm not her.
Example_2: mi dunli do le ka jinvi ma kau le se zukte be le mi'u prenu - I am in concord with you in what we think about his actions.
Related: du'i, satci (exact), frica (differ), simsa (similar), mintu (same)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike x<sub>2</sub> in property/dimension/quantity x<sub>3</sub>.

Related: ranxi (irony), drata (other), dunli (equal), simsa (similar), vrici (assorted)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a cow/cattle/kine/ox/[bull/steer/calf] [beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: bakar(ar), aks(en), vak(es), bail(hi), bik(ru), nieu(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is x<sub>2</sub> liter<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> [metric unit] in volume <span class="word-kind">(default is 1)</font> by standard x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(property - ka)</font> is common/general/universal among members of set x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(complete set)</font>.
Etymology: muctarak(ar), kamn(en), komun(es), samani(hi), opc(ru), pu(zh)

Related: fadni (ordinary), cafne (frequent), rirci (rare), fadni (ordinary), cnano (average), tcaci (custom), lakne (likely), cmima (belong to), simxu (mutual)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a job/occupation/employment/vocation <span class="word-kind">(a type of work regularly done for pay)</font> of person x<sub>2</sub>.

Example_2: xu do se jibri le ka sampla - Do you have the job of a programmer?

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(agent)</font> rewards x<sub>2</sub> [recipient] for atypical x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/property)</font> with reward/desserts x<sub>4</sub>.

x<sub>1</sub> is a pump/injector [tool/apparatus] pumping/inserting fluid x<sub>2</sub> to x<sub>3</sub> from x<sub>4</sub> by means x<sub>5</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> replaces/substitutes for/instead of x<sub>2</sub> in circumstance x<sub>3</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is a replacement/substitute.
Etymology: badal(ar), sabstatiut(en), sustitu(es), badil(hi), smin(ru), ti(zh)
Example_1: ma ba basti do le ka gunka - Who will replace you?
Related: se, ba'i, binra (insure)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an elder/ancestor of x<sub>2</sub> by bond/tie/degree x<sub>3</sub>; x<sub>1</sub>'s generation precedes x<sub>2</sub>'s parents.
Etymology: salaf(ar), grandpernt(en), abol(es), nana(hi), died(ru), zen(zh)
Example_1: do dzena mi le ka ce'u ce'u lidne le ka jbena ca ma kau - You are my ancestor since you were born before me.
Related: patfu (father), rirni (parent), tamne (cousin)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is private/personal/privy/[secret/confidential/confined] to x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is not-public/hidden.
Etymology: xusus(ar), privi(en), privad(es), nij(hi), castn(ru), si(zh)
Example_1: le tadji be le nu zbasu le poi tai kukte vau stasu cu sivni mi - How to make such a tasty soup is a secret to me.
Related: gubni (public), mipri (secret)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> protests/objects to/complains about x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state)</font> to audience x<sub>3</sub> with action x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: ixtaj(ar), protest(en), protest(es), prativad(hi), pratiest(ru), kan(zh)
Example_1: za'u pa gunka pu pante le ka te pleji ma kau vau lei turni ta'i le ka de'a gunka - Workers complained about their salary to the management by halting their work.
Related: xarnu (stubborn)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(mass of facts)</font> is science of/about subject matter x<sub>2</sub> based on methodology x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: ilm(ar), sains(en), siensi(es), castr(hi), nauk(ru), keciue(zh)
Example_1: mi tadni le saske be le mi'u du'u mikce - I study the medical science.
Example_2: le cmaci cu saske le mi'u du'u le namcu cu simxu le ka ckini vau le nu lanli le mi'u namcu - Mathematic is a science of how numbers are related to each other based on their analysis.
Related: datni (data), fatci (actual), djuno (know), cipra (test), pensi (think), jimpe (understand)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects Ukrainian language/culture/nationality in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.
x<sub>1</sub> is a syllable in language x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: makta(ar), silabl(en), silab(es), akcar(hi), slok(ru), iinjie(zh)
Example_1: zoi zoi.sla.zoi slaka la lojban - "sla" is a syllable in Lojban.
Related: sance (sound), valsi (word), bangu (language)

Definition: 3rd assignable variable predicate <span class="word-kind">(context determines place structure)</font>.
Example_1: la alis pu ca'o ku zgana cei brodi le pixra i mi na brodi - Alice was beholding the pictures. I wasn't.
Related: bu'a, broda (predicate var 1)

Definition: 5th assignable variable predicate <span class="word-kind">(context determines place structure)</font>.
Example_1: ti gusta lo se nelci be mi cei brodu i ku'i le ji'a mamta be mi ta'e zbasu lo cidja poi brodu - This restaurant serves the food that I like. However, my mother as well makes food that I like.
Related: bu'a, broda (predicate var 1)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(li)</font> is a number/quantifier/digit/value/figure <span class="word-kind">(noun)</font>; refers to the value and not the symbol.
Etymology: rakm(ar), nambr(en), numer(es), ganan(hi), nomir(ru), cu(zh)
Example_1: li bi namcu - 8 is a number.
Related: lerfu (character), mekso (MEX), klani (amount)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> keeps x<sub>2</sub> secret/hidden from x<sub>3</sub> by method x<sub>4</sub>; x<sub>2</sub> is a secret; x<sub>1</sub> hides/conceals x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: siri(ar), sikrit(en), sekret(es), cip(hi), sekriet(ru), mi(zh)
Example_1: mi pu mipri le mi'u torta le mi'u verba - I hid the pie from the child.
Related: stace (honest), mifra (code), sivni (private), djuno (know), cirko (lose), jarco (show)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a fire/flame in fuel x<sub>2</sub> burning-in/reacting-with oxidizer x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(default air/oxygen)</font>.
Etymology: xarik(ar), fair(en), fog(es), ag(hi), agon(ru), xue(zh)
Example_1: le fagri be le mi'u boske bei le brife co'a carmi - The fire in the forest burning in the wind becomes intense.
Example_2: le mi'u mudri cu se fagri - The wood is burning.
Related: jelca (burn), sacki (match)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense x<sub>2</sub> [person, or sensory activity].
Etymology: caxi(ar), teisti(en), gustos(es), sukad(hi), vkusn(ru), kekeu(zh)

Example_2: ko se kukte - Bon appetite!
Related: gusta (restaurant), ralci (delicate), vrusi (taste), cpina (pungent)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a label/tag of x<sub>2</sub> showing information x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: bitaka(ar), tag(en), etiket(es), cipi(hi), itikietk(ru), biaucian(zh)
Example_1: ti noi sinxa cu tcita le valsi le ka cnino - This symbol labels words as being new.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is to the side of/lateral to x<sub>2</sub> and facing x<sub>3</sub> from point of view/in-frame-of-reference x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: janib(ar), latrl(en), lad(es), satax(hi), starana(ru), mian(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u tanxe cu mlana le mi'u bitmu - The box is to the side of the wall.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is nervous/anxious about x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(abstraction)</font> under conditions x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: kalik(ar), ankcas(en), nervios(es), vikal(hi), balnav(ru), xuan(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur; <span class="word-kind">(intransitive verb)</font>.
Etymology: cara(ar), start(en), prinsipi(es), aramb(hi), nacin(ru), fa(zh)
Example_1: de'i li cy xo le se tigni cu cfari - At what time does the performance begin?

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> exceeds/is more than x<sub>2</sub> in property/quantity x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka/ni)</font> by amount/excess x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: aziad(ar), mor(en), mas(es), ziad(hi), bolc(ru), due(zh)
Example_1: ra zmadu mi le ka tilju vau le ki'ogra be li pa no - He weighs ten more kilograms than I do.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a ballistic projectile [e.g. bullet/missile] for firing by [gun/propelling launcher] x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: kadif(ar), balistik(en), balistik(es), astra(hi), balisticesk(ru), dan(zh)
Example_1: pa danti be le cecla mo'u muvdu le dinju - A bullet from a gun reached the house.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a limit/extreme/bound/border/[confinement] of x<sub>2</sub> in property/domain x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: xad(ar), limit(en), limit(es), sim(hi), granis(ru), jie(zh)
Example_1: ti noi mokca cu jimte mi le ka mo'u se klama - This point is the limit that I can reach.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(property - ka)</font> is a dimension of space/object x<sub>2</sub> according to rules/model x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: bud(ar), dimencn(en), dimension(es), viman(hi), izmirieni(ru), ciduen(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a company/corporation/firm/partnership chartered by authority x<sub>2</sub> for purpose x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: cirka(ar), kampani(en), korporasion(es), sangati(hi), kampani(ru), gunsi(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a/the urine/piss/pee of x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: baul(ar), pi(en), orin(es), pecab(hi), maca(ru), niau(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an article/descriptor labelling description x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(text)</font> in language x<sub>3</sub> with semantics x<sub>4</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> issues commands/orders to x<sub>2</sub> for result x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state)</font> to happen; x<sub>3</sub> is commanded to occur.

Etymology: alam(ar), banr(en), bander(es), jand(hi), flak(ru), ci(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(process)</font> is an art [creative application] of craft/skill x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(idea/activity)</font>.

Etymology: namir(ar), taigr(en), tigr(es), cer(hi), tigr(ru), xu(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a stage/platform/dais/[scaffold] at/in x<sub>2</sub> supporting x<sub>3</sub>, made of material x<sub>4</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object/abstract)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a/the horn [body-part] of x<sub>2</sub>; [metaphor: pointed extremity].

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is dry of liquid x<sub>2</sub>; <span class="word-kind">(adjective:)</font> x<sub>1</sub> is arid.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> repairs/mends/fixes x<sub>2</sub> for use x<sub>3</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects Saudi Arabian culture/nationality in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.
x<sub>1</sub> is fond of/likes/has a taste for x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object/state)</font>.

Example_2: mi nelci le ckafi ne se mau - I prefer coffee.
Related: cinmo (emotion), djica (desire), pluka (pleasant), prami (love), rigni (disgusting), sinma (esteem), trina (attract), xebni (hate), cuxna (choose), pendo (friend)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of x<sub>2</sub>.

Example_1: le mi'u nanla pu ca'o jgari le gerku re'o le cutne - The boy was holding the dog near the chest.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state)</font> is a problem to/encountered by x<sub>2</sub> in situation/task/inquiry x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: muckil(ar), prablm(en), problem(es), samsia(hi), prabliem(ru), nanti(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects Moroccan culture/nationality in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.
x<sub>1</sub> sees/views/perceives visually x<sub>2</sub> under conditions x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: raa(ar), viu(en), vist(es), vicar(hi), vid(ru), kan(zh)
Example_1: pa plise zo'u mi viska le se skari be ri i le mi'u plise cu skari le xunre - There is an apple. I see a color of it. The apple is colored red.
Example_2: mi viska le tarmi be pa najnimre i ri se tarmi le cukla - I see the form of an orange. The orange is round.
Related: catlu (look), jvinu (scene), kanla (eye), minra (reflect), simlu (seem), djuno (know), jimpe (understand), zgana (observe), ganse (feel)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is public/un-hidden/open/jointly available to/owned by all among community x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(mass)</font>.

Example_1: le mi'u tanxe pu vasru so'i cukta - The box was full of books.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is cyan/turquoise/greenish-blue [color adjective].

Example_2: le ka masno bacru cu se ckaji tu noi nanmu - Slow speech is the characteristic of that man.
Related: kai, tcaci (custom), tcini (condition)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> interacts/behaves socially with x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> socializes with/is sociable towards x<sub>2</sub>.

Example_1: ko jikca la'e me'o so pa pa - Dial 911!
Example_2: ra jikca le so'i prenu gi'e di'i gasnu le te salci - He is a sociable person interacting with many people and regularly organizing parties.
Related: tarti (behave), penmi (meet)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [ordered set] is sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules x<sub>2</sub> on unordered set x<sub>3</sub>.

Example_1: li pa ce'o li re ce'o li ci cu porsi le ka ce'u mleca ce'u vau le namcu - 1, 2, 3 is a sequence of numbers where a number to the left is less than the number to the right.
Example_2: mi pu ganse le po'o porsi be fi le valsi i je mi na pu jimpe le smuni be le mi'u porsi - I could only see a sequence of words, the sequence the meaning of which I couldn't understand.
Related: fatne (reverse), ce'o, lidne (lead), liste (list), cmima (belong to)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> lies/rests/reclines/reposes on x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is reclining/recumbent/lying on x<sub>2</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(du'u)</font>.

Example_1: le mi'u du'u le prina be fi le jamfu be pa nixli cu nenri le mi'u dinju cu logji le mi'u du'u la alis pu zvati ti - By the fact that there are footprints of a girl inside the house, one concludes that Alice was here.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> takes revenge on/retaliates against x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(person)</font> for wrong x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(nu)</font> with vengeance x<sub>4</sub> <span class="word-kind">(nu)</font>.

Example_1: la kevin pu venfu la alis le ka kusru la kevin vau le ka cinba la alis re'o pa li'anpi - He took a revenge on Alice being rude to him by kissing her on the cheek.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a message/notice/memorandum about subject x<sub>2</sub> from author x<sub>3</sub> to intended audience x<sub>4</sub>.

Example_1: mi pu zukte le ka da notci le cipra gi'e se jufra lu mi'a nu'o djuno li'u - I made a statement about the experiment: "We don't know yet."

Etymology: maulud(ar), ber(en), nas(es), janma(hi), rojdion(ru), cen(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a branch/bough/limb of x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>2</sub> forks into branches x<sub>1</sub>; [preferred over metaphorical birka].

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(person/object/event)</font> is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(mass)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity quantified/measured/enumerated by x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(quantifier)</font> on scale x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(si'o)</font>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.

x<sub>1</sub> is a law specifying x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(state/event)</font> for community x<sub>3</sub> under conditions x<sub>4</sub> by lawgiver<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>5</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a structure word of grammatical class x<sub>2</sub>, with meaning/function x<sub>3</sub> in usage <span class="word-kind">(language)</font> x<sub>4</sub>.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an embryo/zygote/fetus/fertilized egg with mother x<sub>2</sub>, and father x<sub>3</sub>.

Example_1: le mi'u gerku pu jersi le mi'u jatna fau le ka jai gau slilu le rebla be vo'a - The dog followed the master, wagging its tail.

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is polite/courteous/civil in matter x<sub>2</sub> according to standard/custom x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: lutf(ar), palait(en), kortes(es), cict(hi), viejliv(ru), li(zh)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> attracts/appeals to/lures x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(person/event)</font> with property/quality x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font>.

Example_1: lu i le mlatu cu pinxe li'u jufra le danlu la lojban - {i lo mlatu cu pinxe} is a sentence about animals in Lojban language.
