Etymology: saf(ar), piur(en), pur(es), cudva(hi), cist(ru), cuen(zh)
Example_1: ti noi djine cu curve le ka solji - This ring is of pure gold.
Related: prane (ideal), jinsa (clean), manfo (uniform), sampu (simple), sepli (apart), traji (best), lumci (wash), xukmi (chemical)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a father of x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> begets/sires/acts paternal towards x<sub>2</sub>; [not necessarily biological].
Etymology: ab(ar), pa(en), pap(es), pita(hi), pad(ru), fu(zh)
Example_1: le patfu be mi cu gunka bu'u la tokiios - My father works in Tokio.
Related: mamta (mother), rirni (parent), rorci (procreate), tarbi (embryo), dzena (ancestor), famti (aunt or uncle), panzi (offspring), bersa (son), sovda (egg)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a crust/rind/peel/skin/hide/outer cover of x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: jild(ar), pil(en), piel(es), kal(hi), kaj(ru), pi(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u najnimre co'u se pilka - The orange has been peeled off.
Example_2: mi pu vimcu le pilka be le mi'u plise - I peeled the apple off.
Related: grute (fruit), calku (shell), skapi (pelt), gacri (cover)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a star/sun with stellar properties x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: najm(ar), star(en), estrei(es), tar(hi), zvizd(ru), cin(zh)
Example_1: xu nai pluka fa le ka catlu le tarci ca le nicte - Isn't it pleasant to look at stars at night?
Related: solri (solar), tsani (sky)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is to the east/eastern side of x<sub>2</sub> according to frame of reference x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: cark(ar), ist(en), est(es), purab(hi), vastok(ru), dun(zh)
Example_1: le nurma zdani be mi cu stuna le mi'u tcadu zdani - My rural house is to the west of the city apartment when viewed from here.
Related: stici (west), berti (north), snanu (south), farna (direction)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a word meaning/causing x<sub>2</sub> in language x<sub>3</sub>; <span class="word-kind">(adjective: x<sub>1</sub> is lexical/verbal)</font>.
Etymology: kalim(ar), urd(en), vokabl(es), vacan(hi), slov(ru), si(zh)
Example_1: zoi sy.parte.sy. valsi le ka pagbu vau le spano - "parte" means "part" in Spanish language.
Related: slaka (syllable), bangu (language), cmavo (structure word), cmene (name), gismu (root word), jufra (sentence), rafsi (affix), smuni (meaning)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is favorable/great/superb/fabulous/dandy/outstanding/swell/admirable/nice/commendable/delightful/desirable/enjoyable/laudable/likable/lovable/wonderful/praiseworthy/high-quality/cool in property x<sub>2</sub> by standard x<sub>3</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> rocks in aspect x<sub>2</sub> according to x<sub>3</sub>
Etymology: sabix(ar), bena(en), bien(es), saxaiak(hi), blagaskion(ru), zan(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u jisra cu zabna le ka se tasta - The juice is superb in taste.
Example_2: ra zabna le ka se sance - Her voice is cool.
Related: mabla (bloody), xamgu (beneficial), funca (luck), vrude (virtue), banli (great)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(mass/si'o)</font> is a class/category/subgroup/subset within x<sub>2</sub> with defining property x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font>.
Etymology: sinaf(ar), klas(en), klas(es), varg(hi), klas(ru), lei(zh)
Example_1: mi cmima le klesi be le se zdani bei le ka vecnu - I belong to the merchant class of inhabitants.
Example_2: do na klesi lei se nelci be mi - You are not my type.
Related: me, cmima (belong to), jutsi (species), ciste (system), girzu (group), lanzu (family), vrici (assorted)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> stands [is vertically oriented] on surface x<sub>2</sub> supported by limbs/support/pedestal x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: intasab(ar), stand(en), levant(es), stan(hi), stai(ru), li(zh)
Example_1: ra pu sanli le canre le jamfu - He was standing on the sand on his feet.
Related: kamju (column), sraji (vertical), tuple (leg), zbepi (pedestal), sarji (support)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property<span class="word-kind">(ies)</font> x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: rax(ar), kamfrt(en), konfort(es), aram(hi), kamfartabil(ru), cufu(zh)
Example_1: mi kufra le ka vreta bu'u le jbini be re kicne - I feel comfortable lying between the two pillows.
Related: cinmo (emotion)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> frowns/grimaces <span class="word-kind">(facial expression)</font>.
Etymology: jaxuma(ar), fraun(en), fruns(es), brubag(hi), xmur(ru), jeumeiteu(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u nakni pu frumu ca le nu ri catlu mi - He frowned looking at me.
Related: cmila (laugh), cisma (smile)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [abrasive/cutting/scratching object/implement] scratches/[carves]/erodes/cuts [into] x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: xak(ar), skrac(en), rask(es), kurac(hi), sarap(ru), sau(zh)
Example_1: mi pu sraku le stedu be mi - I scratched my head.
Related: guska (scrape), katna (cut), mosra (friction), plixa (plow), kakpa (dig), spali (polish)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an infant/baby [helpless through youth/incomplete development] of species x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: tifl(ar), infnt(en), infant(es), cicu(hi), rebion(ru), iin(zh)
Example_1: xu le mi'u cifnu xa'o jimpe le lojbo se smusku - Does the infant understand Lojban yet?
Related: makcu (mature), verba (child), citno (young), panzi (offspring)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a chicken/[hen/cock/rooster]/small fowl [a type of bird] of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: dajaj(ar), cikn(en), poi(es), cingan(hi), kuris(ru), ji(zh)
Example_1: le jipci cu nelci le tsiju - Chickens like seeds.
Related: cipni (bird)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is an angle [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex x<sub>2</sub> subtended by lateral [segment] x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: zaui(ar), angl(en), angul(es), gana(hi), ugal(ru), jiau(zh)
Example_1: ti jganu me'o a bu le mitre be li pi mu gi'e stero be li re - This is an angle from vertex A having the lateral of 0.5 meters and subtending two steradians.
Related: kojna (corner), linji (line), konju (cone), mokca (point)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a nation/ethnic group of peoples x<sub>2</sub>; [people sharing a history/culture].
Etymology: kaum(ar), nacn(en), nasion(es), jati(hi), nasian(ru), min(zh)
Example_1: le se natmi be ma cu se zdani le vi se kuspe - People of what nationality live in this area?
Example_2: do se natmi ma - What is your nationality?
Related: jecta (polity), kulnu (culture), lanzu (family), gugde (country), bangu (language), cecmu (community)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a pelt/skin/hide/leather from x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: jild(ar), skin(en), piel(es), kal(hi), ckup(ru), pi(zh)
Example_1: le skapi be le cnebo be mi cu xunre - The skin on my neck is red.
Related: pilka (crust), calku (shell), kerfa (hair)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is foreign/alien/[exotic]/unfamiliar to x<sub>2</sub> in property x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font>.
Etymology: ajnabi(ar), farin(en), ekstranxer(es), aniadec(hi), inastran(ru), uaigue(zh)
Example_1: ra fange mi le ka zukte ma kau - He is alien to me in what he does.
Related: cizra (strange), jbena (born), ckini (related)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form x<sub>2</sub> from x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: nabat(ar), gro(en), brot(es), bar(hi), rasti(ru), jan(zh)
Example_1: le spati ca'o banro le tricu pa se katna jimca - The plant is growing into a tree from a cut off branch.
Related: farvi (develop), zenba (increase), jmina (add), barda (big), makcu (mature), ferti (fertile)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is infinite/unending/eternal in property/dimension x<sub>2</sub>, to degree x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(quantity)</font>/of type x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: lanixai(ar), infanit(en), infinit(es), asim(hi), biskaniec(ru), uuciun(zh)
Example_1: si'au le mi'u nu penmi cu cimni le ka se ditcu - It seems to me, the meeting will never end.
Example_2: le mi'u munje cu cimni le ka se canlu - The world is infinite in space.
Related: vitno (permanent), renvi (survive), munje (universe), fanmo (end), sisti (cease)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of foam/froth/suds of material x<sub>2</sub>, with bubbles/vacuoles of material x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: raga(ar), fom(en), espum(es), fen(hi), pien(ru), mo(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u glare pu ru'i cupra le fonmo be le djacu bei le gapci - The heat was producing bubbles of gas in the water.
Related: zbabu (soap)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument].
Etymology: flut(ar), faif(en), flaut(es), vanci(hi), flieit(ru), guan(zh)
Example_1: le sance be le mi'u flani cu jai pluka - The flute has a pleasant sound.
Related: zgike (music)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a dog/canine/[bitch] of species/breed x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: kalb(ar), dag(en), per(es), kuta(hi), sabak(ru), geu(zh)
Example_1: mi jai gau citka fai le gerku pe mi re roi ro djedi - I feed my dog twice a day.
Related: lorxu (fox), labno (wolf), mlatu (cat)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a bead/pebble [shape/form] of material x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: xaraz(ar), bid(en), abalor(es), mank(hi), bisir(ru), ju(zh)
Example_1: pu ku mu bidju ti zvati - There were five pebbles here.
Related: bolci (ball), canre (sand), lakse (wax), dirgo (drop)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is dust/precipitate [suspensible solid] from x<sub>2</sub> in medium/on surface x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: gubar(ar), dast(en), polv(es), dul(hi), pil(ru), cen(zh)
Example_1: le pulce pu gacri le mi'u loldi - Dust covered the floor.
Example_2: le pulce brife cu muvdu ti - A dust storm is coming.
Related: te, zalvi (grind), danmo (smoke), purmo (powder), sligu (solid)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of/contains/is made of ceramic made by x<sub>2</sub>, of composition x<sub>3</sub>, in form/shape x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: xazaf(ar), saramik(en), seramik(es), mritik(hi), kiramicisk(ru), tau(zh)
Example_1: mi se cinri tu'a le jungo staku - I have an interest in Chinese ceramics.
Related: kliti (clay)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is the view/scene/panorama/sight/prospect of x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object/location)</font> from point-of-view x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: mandar(ar), viu(en), vist(es), dirc(hi), vid(ru), jin(zh)
Example_1: le jvinu be le xamsi bei le kumfa pe mi cu banli - I have a great view of the sea from my room.
Related: catlu (look), kanla (eye), viska (see), canko (window), jarco (show)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is the direction of x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object/event)</font> from origin/in frame of reference x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: tauji(ar), darekcn(en), direksion(es), taraf(hi), starana(ru), fan(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u canko cu farna le nu la alis pu catlu vau mi - From my viewpoint, Alice was looking at the direction of the window.
Related: zunle (left), pritu (right), galtu (high), gapru (above), cnita (below), dizlo (low), berti (north), snanu (south), stuna (east), stici (west), purci (past), balvi (future), lidne (lead)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> coughs/farts/burps up/out x<sub>2</sub> [predominantly gaseous] from orifice x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: sual(ar), kaf(en), tos(es), kas(hi), kacil(ru), ke(zh)
Example_1: ra pu kafke le barda le ganxo - He made a big fart.
Related: bilma (ill), senci (sneeze), sputu (spit), vamtu (vomit)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is to the north/northern side [right-hand-rule pole] of x<sub>2</sub> according to frame of reference x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: camal(ar), nort(en), nort(es), utar(hi), sievir(ru), bei(zh)
Example_1: le za'u pa purdi be fi le'e grute cu berti le tcadu - Fruit gardens are to the north of the city.
Related: snanu (south), stici (west), stuna (east), farna (direction)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(du'u)</font> is false/is an untruth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: kadib(ar), fals(en), fals(es), jut(hi), loj(ru), jia(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u du'u le mi'u nanla cu se slabu la alis cu jitfa le mi'u du'u le mi'u nanla cu kucli le nu la alis cu mo kau - It's false that the boy is familiar with Alice since he is wondering who she is.
Related: fatci (actual), stace (honest), jetnu (true), cfika (fiction)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> remains/stays at/abides/lasts with x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: bakii(ar), stei(en), rest(es), taxar(hi), astaits(ru), lieu(zh)
Example_1: mi te mukti le ka stali vi ku ze'a le djedi be li ci - I am going to stay here for three days.
Related: vitno (permanent), zasni (temporary), ralte (hold), stodi (constant), xabju (dwell), stuzi (location), renvi (survive)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a nest/house/lair/den/[home] of/for x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: uakr(ar), den(en), nid(es), nir(hi), gnizdo(ru), fan(zh)
Example_1: le zdani be mi cu zdani be do - My home is your home.
Related: se, xabju (dwell), marbi (shelter), dinju (building), ginka (camp), kumfa (room)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a history of x<sub>2</sub> according to x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(person)</font>/from point-of-view x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: tarix(ar), xistri(en), istori(es), itixas(hi), istori(ru), ci(zh)
Example_1: mi tadni le citri be le mi'u kagni bei le cnino lanli - I'm studying the history of the company according to new analysts.
Related: muzga (museum), purci (past)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer x<sub>2</sub> in feature x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(ka)</font> by standard x<sub>4</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is a novelty.
Etymology: jadid(ar), niu(en), nov(es), navin(hi), nov(ru), cin(zh)
Example_1: le pendo be mi co'a cnino mi le ka kakne le ka zgipli le pipno - My friend appeared new to me in being able to play the piano.
Example_2: cnino fa no cnita be le mi'u lunra - Nothing is new under the Moon (saying).
Related: nuzba (news), slabu (familiar), citno (young), djuno (know)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a human/human being/man <span class="word-kind">(non-specific gender-free sense)</font>; <span class="word-kind">(adjective:)</font> x<sub>1</sub> is human.
Etymology: incan(ar), iumn(en), uman(es), manav(hi), liutsko(ru), ren(zh)
Example_1: xu le remna ku po'o ka'e cmila - Can only humans laugh?
Related: nanmu (man), ninmu (woman), prenu (people)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [agent] succeeds in/achieves/completes/accomplishes x<sub>2</sub> as a result of effort/attempt/try x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: najax(ar), saksid(en), konseg(es), sapal(hi), uda(ru), da(zh)
Example_1: mi pu snada le ka gasnu tu'a le fagri vau le ka jai gau mosra pa grana pa grana - I succeeded in producing fire by rubbing one stick against another.
Related: fliba (fail), troci (attempt), jgira (pride)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> brakes/causes to slow motion/activity x<sub>2</sub> with device/mechanism/principle x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: kabix(ar), breik(en), fren(es), brek(hi), tormas(ru), ja(zh)
Example_1: do jabre le nu mi gunka vau le ka ru'i tavla - You slow my work down by your constant talk.
Related: mosra (friction)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of/is made of/contains steel of composition including x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: sulb(ar), stil(en), aser(es), ispat(hi), stal(ru), gan(zh)
Example_1: le balre be ti noi dakfu cu gasta - The blade of this knife is made of steel.
Related: jinme (metal), molki (mill), tirse (iron)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a train [vehicle] of cars/units x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(mass)</font> for rails/system/railroad x<sub>3</sub>, propelled by x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: kitar(ar), trein(en), tren(es), tren(hi), paist(ru), liece(zh)
Example_1: ti trene le mu mei - This train consists of 5 cars.
Example_2: so'i da trene le kumte la silka dargu - There are many camel caravans on the Silk Road.
Related: tcana (station), kumte (camel)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> feels guilt/remorse about x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(abstraction)</font>.
Etymology: mudnib(ar), gilt(en), kompunx(es), doc(hi), vina(ru), zuei(zh)
Example_1: mi zungi le ka pu smusku le jitfa - I feel guilty about having told a lie.
Related: u'u, cinmo (emotion), xenru (regret), zekri (crime)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is shallow in extent in direction/property x<sub>2</sub> away from reference point x<sub>3</sub> by standard x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: daxl(ar), calo(en), bax(es), cical(hi), mielk(ru), cian(zh)
Example_1: ti noi lalxu cu caxno le ka sraji vau le sefta be vo'a - This lake is shallow in separating its bottom from its surface.
Related: condi (deep), tordu (short), jarki (narrow), cinla (thin), cmalu (small), jarki (narrow), jmifa (reef)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is brother of/fraternal to x<sub>2</sub> by bond/tie/standard/parent<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>3</sub>; [not necess. biological].
Etymology: ax(ar), bradr(en), erman(es), brat(hi), brat(ru), ciun(zh)
Example_1: do bruna mi le ka se mamta - You are my brother since we are born from the same mother.
Related: mensi (sister), tunba (sibling), tamne (cousin), famti (aunt or uncle), bersa (son)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a meaning/interpretation of x<sub>2</sub> recognized/seen/accepted by x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: manan(ar), minin(en), signifik(es), sucit(hi), znacieni(ru), uei(zh)
Example_1: ma lojbo smuni zoi sy.hola.sy. poi spano - What is the Lojban for Spanish "hola"?
Example_2: mi pu te smuni zoi zoi.y.zoi le nu mi na birti - By saying {y} I meant that I wasn't sure.
Related: jimpe (understand), sinxa (represent), valsi (word), tanru (binary metaphor), gismu (root word), lujvo (affix compound), cmavo (structure word), jufra (sentence)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a quantity of maize/corn [grain] of species/strain x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: dura(ar), meiz(en), mais(es), marki(hi), mais(ru), iumi(zh)
Example_1: mi sombo le samcu e le zumri - I plant yams and maize.
Related: gurni (grain)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> [person] labors/works on/at x<sub>2</sub> [activity] with goal/objective x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: amil(ar), urk(en), trabax(es), kam(hi), rabot(ru), gun(zh)
Example_1: mi gunka le ka tadni la lojban vau le ka sutra tavla bau la lojban - I'm working on learning Lojban in order to quickly talk in it.
Related: sazri (operate), gasnu (bring about), se, jibri (job), briju (office), lazni (lazy), akti, selfu (serve)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> precedes/leads x<sub>2</sub> in sequence x<sub>3</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is former/preceding/previous; x<sub>2</sub> is latter/following.
Etymology: murcid(ar), lidr(en), lider(es), neta(hi), lidir(ru), lin(zh)
Example_1: le mlatu ba lidne le gerku le ka se casnu ca ma kau - Cats will be discussed before dogs.
Related: balvi (future), ralju (principal), rebla (tail), purci (past), jersi (chase), porsi (sequence), jatna (captain), farna (direction)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is on the outside of x<sub>2</sub>; x<sub>1</sub> is exterior to x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: xarij(ar), aut(en), for(es), baxar(hi), naruju(ru), biau(zh)
Example_1: ei mi klama lo bartu be le zdani - I should go out.
Related: jibni (near), nenri (in), sruri (surround), lamji (adjacent), korbi (edge), calku (shell), vasru (contain)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a hospital treating patient<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>2</sub> for condition/injuries/disease/illness x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: mustacfa(ar), xaspitl(en), ospital(es), aspatal(hi), balnis(ru), iiiuan(zh)
Example_1: tu spita le verba le te bilma pe gau le vidru - That is a hospital treating children for viral diseases.
Related: bilma (ill), mikce (doctor)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a [physical] page/leaf of book/document/bound mass of pages x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: safxa(ar), peij(en), paxin(es), patr(hi), stranis(ru), mianr(zh)
Example_1: ko catlu ti noi papri le cukta - Look at this page of the book.
Related: karni (journal), pelji (paper), prina (print), xatra (letter), vreji (record), pezli (leaf), cukta (book), ciska (write)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.
Example_1: au mi viska le friko xanto - I want to see African elephants.
Related: ropno (European), xazdo (Asiatic)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> reflects Portuguese culture/nationality/language in aspect x<sub>2</sub>.
Example_1: le mi'u ninmu cu tavla fo le porto - She speaks Portuguese.
Related: brazo (Brazilian)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> hopes/wishes for/desires x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event)</font>, expected likelihood x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(0-1)</font>; x<sub>1</sub> hopes that x<sub>2</sub> happens.
Etymology: amal(ar), xop(en), esper(es), aca(hi), nadie(ru), pan(zh)
Example_1: mi pacna fi li so'a fe le nu solri ba zi - I hope it will be sunny soon.
Example_2: mi pacna fi li so'u fe le nu do klama - I wish you came.
Related: djica (desire)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> organizes x<sub>2</sub> [relative chaos] into x<sub>3</sub> [ordered/organized result] by system/principle<span class="word-kind">(s)</font> x<sub>4</sub>.
Etymology: nadam(ar), organaiz(en), organis(es), sangatit(hi), arganiz(ru), zu(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u turni pu ganzu le ruble prenu le vlipa jenmi le ka bapli le nu le mi'u jenmi cu zukte le te minde - He turned weak people into a powerful army by making them execute orders.
Related: ciste (system), morna (pattern), stura (structure), cabra (apparatus)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> <span class="word-kind">(mass)</font> is a quantity of salad [food] with ingredients/components including x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: salata(ar), salad(en), ensalad(es), salad(hi), salat(ru), sela(zh)
Example_1: mi nelci le salta be le grute - I like fruit salads.
Related: mixre (mixture), stasu (soup)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is stubborn/willfully opposing/resisting x<sub>2</sub> about x<sub>3</sub> <span class="word-kind">(event/state)</font>.
Etymology: anid(ar), stabrn(en), testarud(es), xatil(hi), uporn(ru), uangu(zh)
Example_1: le mi'u nakni cu xarnu le mamta be vo'a le ka na volta le zdani - He was obstinate in front of his mother in not returning home.
Example_2: le mi'u fetsi ca xarnu fi le ka jinvi ma kau - She is obstinate in her opinion.
Related: tinsa (stiff), pante (protest), bapli (effective), fapro (oppose)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> tells about/describes x<sub>2</sub> <span class="word-kind">(object/event/state)</font> to audience x<sub>3</sub> with description x<sub>4</sub> <span class="word-kind">(property)</font>.
Etymology: rasam(ar), diskraib(en), deskrib(es), kinc(hi), opic(ru), miaucu(zh)
Example_1: le gidva pu skicu fi mi'a fe le nu mi'a cliva ca le lerci vau le nu le aftobuso nu'o mo'u klama - The guide explained to us that we would leave later in that the bus hadn't yet arrived.
Example_2: mi pu skicu pa cinri lisri pa panzi be mi - I told an interesting story to my child.
Related: lisri (story), tavla (talk)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is a gymnast at/performs gymnastics feat x<sub>2</sub>.
Etymology: baxluan(ar), akrabat(en), akrobat(es), kalabaz(hi), akrabat(ru), zaji(zh)
Example_1: ra zajba le ka se rilti muvdu - He is a rhythmic gymnast.
Related: sluji (muscle), dansu (dance)

Definition: x<sub>1</sub> is summer/summertime [hot season] of year x<sub>2</sub> at location x<sub>3</sub>.
Etymology: saif(ar), samr(en), veran(es), gricm(hi), pet(ru), cia(zh)
Example_1: ca crisa le re no no mu moi be le nanca ti - Now it's summer of year 2005 at my place.
Related: citsi (season), critu (autumn), dunra (winter), vensa (spring)
